author: Special Correspondent
text:
Three members of the outlawed Communist Party of India (Maoist) were killed in a gun battle with the police in Narayanpur district of south Chhattisgarh on Tuesday, police said.

Bastar Inspector General of Police S.R.P. Kalluri said, “Four or five more Maoists may have been injured in the encounter and we are still searching for them. All our personnel are safe.” One INSAS rifle, one 315 rifle and three country-made weapons were recovered from the spot,” Mr. Kalluri added.
title: Three Maoists killed in Chhattisgarh gun battle
